favourite.article: Dear Peter Cua, You can search for this song on Youtube as well, with backup vocals to help you along. May you enjoy more of Christ through these hymns. Keen

I learned about this hymn from my sister. I like the lyrics and the tune, but I find it rather difficult to sing along. This is a wonderful site, but it would be very very much better if there would be someone singing the hymn so it would be easy for newbies like me to follow. Just a little suggestion.

Wonderful, sweet, & simple song to sing to the Lord:) So very true, nothing is quite so precious as Jesus in our spirit. May His mercy & grace continue to reach day by day, so that we may continue to enjoy Him & love Him whatever may be happening in our environment. Lord Jesus we lovely...we really love You!

I really enjoy the comments of Steve Miller throughout this website, helping us to enjoy the hymns more by providing historical context and great musical comments. Brother Steve, I believe Galatians 2:20 strongly supports "It's nothing I do". "It is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me." Also in another portion Paul says: "I labored more abundantly than all of them - yet not I but the grace of God in me." So it is not that nothing is DONE. It is that what is done does not issue from ME. I died. A dead person can do nothing, by definition. So there is nothing for ME to do, I have turned it over to God and his mercy, for Him to do it all. You may enjoy the book "The Christian's Secret of a Happy Life" by Hannah Whitall Smith on this topic, or "The Overcoming LIfe" by Watchman Nee.

In John chapter 6, the people wanted to do the work of God, but the Lord answered that the work of God is to believe in Him, that is to eat Him. Furthermore he who eats Him shall live by Him. It is not our doing, but His grace, Himself enjoyed by us, doing everything for us, in us, and through us.

Nothing, oh... Nothing is quite so precious than Jesus in my spirit! Hallelujah! I love this song, for it paints a beautiful picture on how it is only the Lord's mercy that brings us out of everything into Himself, that is a life in resurrection... Praise the Lord! The Lord's grace be with your spirit!

This song breathes rest in Christ to me. When we turn our heart to Him in response to His touching our heart, our mind, reminding us we haven't called on Him, breathed Him in (since when?), then He does in us what we really need and that is Him.

The line in verse 2 "It's nothing I do" goes beyond the truth of the Bible. Is there any verse to support that? "It is not of me, but of God who shows mercy" (Rom 9:16) , but that doesn't mean that I shouldn't do anything or that what I do doesn't matter.

It is me again! I just feel God needs to let the two women who actually were inspired by this song to know that it was HIM who gave it to them in 1990's! This song is and will always be in my heart Trish and Crystal~I love you sisters~see you with Him someday!!! xoxoxooxoxoxoxo
In 1995, I met two incredible sisters in Christ! Their names were Trish Amason and Crystal Styles~they each had a way to touch the Spirit of Christ within me.

We are so blessed to be able to call Him in our times of need and He supplies us with His very life and we realize that His life can help us overcome any obstacle. OH LORD HELP US IN OUR WEAKNESS!!!!!!!!!!
The Lord is so faithful in many ways. He sufficiently supply us with His life. Nothing's quite so precious as the Lord is in our life. Praise the Lord!

It's so good to call LORD JESUS. HELP ME IN MY WEAKNESS.
I call His name, "Lord Jesus, Help me in my weakness." So faithfully each day in me He proves His life is so sufficient.

He never leaves me, E'en as the days grow weary. His presence goes with me. My soul delights to hide in his arms.
I just enjoy that God is always with us. He's always there to just comfort us. We just have to make a little turn, and then He's already there.

Nothing's quite so precious as Jesus in my spirit. I call His name, "Lord Jesus, Help me in my weakness." So faithfully each day in me He proves His life is so sufficient. Our God is so faithful. Praise Him for His preciousness to us.
It's nothing I doâ€” His mercy's just upon me. And God's free gift of grace Becomes an endless joy to me.

This song reminds me of the preciousness of the Lord Jesus in my spirit, and I was reminded again that nothing in this world can satisfy me and meet my need but Him in my spirit. He as the Spirit in my spirit is so sufficient. Now, I am encourage to always turn to my mingled spirit by calling on Him.

I learned this hymn many years ago, but it's not until now that I feel I have entered into the spirit of the hymn to really ponder and inhale each word and make it my own prayer. Oh Lord! Nothing is quite so precious!!!! How my soul delights to hide in Your arms....Lord Jesus!!! Help me in my weakness....so faithfully each day in me You prove Your life is so sufficient..Lord...bring this "endless joy" to me...

As I considered this thought - the value of something is usually what it is worth....I had to reconsider the things I treasure, what I spend my time on...The things that I consider to be so precious, if not on the Lord, it really becomes vanity. I just considered when you know the value of something precious you will not hesitate to pay whatever the price is to obtain it. Okay, what I'm trying to say is that I, just for a moment, had to re-evaluate our dear and precious Lord Jesus. This hymn helped me to truly turn my heart to Lord and say....
Lord grant to me/us a fresh revelation of Yourself so that we would be willing to pay the price, whatever it may be, to experience and gain You. We want to really appreciate You and the process You went through in order to enter into our spirit. But- O Lord, don't stop there, do spread and make Yourself at home in ALL our heart. Build us up together Lord.
Upon this rock (not only the revelation of the church but also the revelation of Christ) He promised to build His church!!!

This hymn is a classic because the reality is that there is absolutely nothing quite so precious as this Man-Savior Jesus in our spirit! If you check your experience you will see that no one or nothing can compare to this precious Person living and dwelling within you.
Wonderful song. So true.

It's so true... there isn't ANY thing quite as precious. I think that this is a very wonderful song. and i'm very grateful to my friend for intoducing it to me. It was just perfect. b/c when all seemed to be at a loss and i was very down.. this REALLY encourages me. Praise the Lord! He is SO precious! =)
Praise Him!!! for He is faithful. I call His name, "Lord Jesus". So Faithfully each day in me He proves His life is so sufficient!!!

I sing this hymn whenever I really feel that He protects me with a helping hand. He helps me in my weakness! Hallelujah! We don't need to struggle for our difficulties. Oh, what a wonderful salvation of our Lord!

One day I was in desperate need of the Lord. Then this song came to me and reminded me that I have no need to fear because He never leaves me, and that His very life is SUFFICIENT. Thank you Lord for being so faithful! I love You and Your recovery.
Although I am busy, I enjoy Him. I never forget the Christ is so precious! Amen!
When I sang this hymn, I felt that only Jesus in my spirit and NOTHING is more precious than Jesus in my spirit! Praise the Lord for this wonderful hymn!
